definition: pet name for a child/childhood name
small/tiny/few/young
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: For convenience, the couple also called their youngest son "JJ".
sentences.chinese: 为了方便，小普雷斯顿也有个“JJ”的小名。

sentences.english: She recognised her family and even knew their nicknames.
sentences.chinese: 他认出了他的家人，甚至知道他们的小名。

sentences.english: I love her Chinese name and want to continue to use it as a family nick-name.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢她的中文名字，也想继续把它用做她的小名。

sentences.english: Fishing boats and vehicles were carried ashore at Onahama port in Iwaki city.
sentences.chinese: 盘成郡的小名滨港口的渔船和车辆随波漂流。

sentences.english: He resented being called his nickname.
sentences.chinese: 他讨厌被人叫他的小名。

sentences.english: Nicknamed Woz, he is often referred to as the other Steve of Apple.
sentences.chinese: 沃兹是他的小名，他是苹果公司的另一位创始人。

sentences.english: Yang Guifei , originally named Yang Yuhuan, was one of the Four Beauties in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 杨贵妃，小名玉环，中国古代四大美人之一。

sentences.english: It was all because of the middle name "stupid" my mother gave me.
sentences.chinese: 都怨俺妈给俺起的小名“周笨驰”中间这个字。

variant of 叫[jiao4]
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
stage name (of an actor or actress)
to name/to christen/to take a name
